page.title: 05Faldingworth School Today
page.content: Faldingworth is a mixed County Primary School admitting children aged 5 to 11. The school serves the parishes of Faldingworth, Buslingthorpe, Wickenby, Lissington, Snelland, Friesthorpe, Snarford and Toft Newton (which includes Virginia Estate). Two coaches are provided by the County Council to transport children from the outlying villages. Since the Easter of 1981 children who have stayed at the school at dinner time have had to bring their own packed lunches as the provision of school dinners was discontinued. In September 1985 there were 96 children on roll divided into four classes according to age. At the age of 11 most children transfer to De Aston Comprehensive School at Market Rasen.
